    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(int symbol,
                  int... cumulativeCount)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: ArithmeticCodec.Encoder
        Writes a symbol of an alphabet with a given input probability distribution.
        Specified by:
        write in interface ArithmeticCodec.Encoder
        Parameters:
        symbol - symbol to be written, between 0, inclusive, and cumulativeCount.length, exclusive.
        cumulativeCount - discrete cumulative count function; non-decreasing count of symbols f(i) up to symbol i. Probability of each symbol i can be computed as (f(i) - f(i-1)) / (f(f.length - 1)) (f(-1) = 0). If f(i) == f(i - 1) then symbol i is unexpected; in this case IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: ArithmeticCodec.Encoder
        Flushes whatever internal state is stored in this Encoder. This Encoder should not be used anymore. Any other call to this Encoder invokes undefined behavior.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface ArithmeticCodec.Encoder
        Throws:
        IOException

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class AnyBaseArithmeticCodec
